JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: VIKING seeks a SAP FI/CO Specialist
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
JOIN VIKING – and become a lifesaver

As a global leader in its field, VIKING Life-Saving Equipment A/S has a clear mission: to protect and save lives all over the world. This relies on continuous innovation in safety equipment, service and training, which is made possible by the great people we bring together.

We develop game-changing safety solutions for the world’s leading cruise and ferry owners, commercial shipping companies, offshore energy operators, navies and other maritime organizations. We see the world as our home market - and we think and act from a global perspective. We are looking for recruits who are ready to experience a dynamic and inspiring working environment and join our skilled and diverse workforce.

VIKING’s exciting SAP journey
VIKING is on a very exciting SAP journey with many exiting SAP projects and an upcoming S/4HANA implementation starting in 2022.

Our current SAP ECC platform, developed from 2005, supports core business areas/processes, using the SAP ECC modules FI/CO, MM, SD, LES, PP, PS, CS, PM and QM. In addition, we run SAP Ariba, SAP Success Factors, SAP Concur, SAP HCM, SAP PO and SAP CPI. SAP also supports our business processes through integration, for example to Service Now and Microsoft solutions.

Where do you come in?
We are looking for an experienced SAP FI/CO Specialist to join our global SAP Applications Management Team of 14 people with colleagues in Thailand, Denmark, Bulgaria, Singapore and China. The position is based in Esbjerg, Denmark.

Reporting to the SAP Applications Management lead, you will be delivering SAP FI/CO and legal solutions through projects, request for changes and 2nd level support – including knowledge building within our business to ensure proper/right utilization of processes and solutions at key/end user level.

Primary tasks and responsibilities
The SAP FI/CO Specialist will play a key role in the transition to SAP S/4HANA and in our continuous development and support of SAP FI/CO and legal solutions.

Key tasks will include:

  • Analyze, design, configure and specify areas for development, providing solution documentation and testing in connection with projects (e.g., S/4HANA, roll-out projects, legal projects) – and Request For Changes.
  • Project coordination/management/participation
  • Act as product owner in the SAP Finance Scrum Team
  • Establish monitoring solutions for critical process steps/solutions
  • Create end user documentation/manuals
  • Arrange and conduct meetings with potential IT vendors on third party solutions and write Request for Proposals (RFPs) for potential vendors – includes writing business cases and investment requests for upper management
  • Evaluate vendor responses to RFPs and participate in negotiations with potential IT vendors
  • Take responsibility for approval of users/authorizations

Depending on Covid-19 restrictions, you should expect 5-10 travel days globally per year.

Who are you?
In your career you have already been part of larger SAP projects involving multiple stakeholders and you are comfortable aligning the various demands and possibilities. You have a good overview of business processes and the integration with SAP FI/CO in the broader context of business goals and requirements of a global organization.

The ideal candidate has 3+ years of experience with SAP FI/CO and a background in a similar position at a global manufacturing or consulting company using SAP.

  • You are used to collaborating with developers and understand key concepts such as table structures and user exits/enhancements
  • You have written functional specifications for developers
  • You can communicate freely at all organizational levels in English, as well as in Danish

On the personal level you are a team player with a positive and results-oriented attitude.

You will either live in the Esbjerg area or the Triangle Region of Jutland, or you are willing to move to the area from another location.

Your VIKING journey starts here
Applications are submitted online via “send application”, which is located at the top-right of the page. Applicants will be contacted throughout the hiring process, and the position will be filled once we have found the right candidate. All applications will be handled confidentially.

Desired start date: as soon as possible, but we are willing to wait for the right candidate.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact Senior Global HR Business Partner Jane Simonsen by phone: + 45 2542 8269.

For further information, please visit our website www.VIKING-life.com to learn more about our company, our products and our core values.

#STAYSAFE
